result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D. Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond of $250.00 applied to court costs.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo a psychological evaluation and follow through with recommended treatment.

Counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission.
AODA and follow through with treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall begin no laer than 11/30/2014 at 4:30 pm.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Any unpaid costs are to be reduced to a civil judgment.

Defendant shall undergo any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

Days Credit Worksheet
Corrected Revocation Summary

Defendant Justin D. Reese in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Paul indicated that there was a mistake in the revocation packet and informed court of the mistake.  Victim rights complied.  Argument by counsel regarding sentencing.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders 1 year 6 months initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision conditions of extended supervision are an AODA and follow through with any recommendations; any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; any unpaid costs shall be reduced to a civil judgment  Defendant is eligible to substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.  322 days sentence credit.  Case No. 14CM29 and 14CT23  defendant has unpaid court obligations.  The court will suspend payments and lift the commitment order and orders that he start repaying the unpaid court obligations at the rate of $25 dollars a month beginning 30 days after his release from prison.  - rt
Letter from Attorney Paul
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin D. Reese in court with attorney James R. Kurszewski.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  Preliminary hearing waived freely, voluntarily, and intelligently and bound DE over for trial.  Information filed mirroring the criminal complaint, with further reading waived.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement Ct. 1 is dismissed and read in.  Brief comments by counsel.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  6 months T.C. jail with Huber commencing no later than 11/30/2014; payment of court costs; DNA sample or show proof of prior submission; pay DNA surcharge - $250; undergo AODA and follow through with treatment; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; undergo psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations; and no contact with co-defendants.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances.

Defendant Justin D. Reese in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommended a $2000 signature bond with booking and not consume or possess any controlled substances.  So ordered.
